input_text.327: dear ian, i really regret that you are going to leave us. we all appreciate you as a good colleague, especially me. i did some research regarding claustrophobia. the symptoms are i.g. feelings of anxienty, panic and the desire to move and stay near an exit. i never recognised these symptoms while working with you. sometimes i saw you breathing heavily or sweating, but i thought that these symptoms were caused by our workload. i''m so sorry that i didn''t identify these symptoms as a part of your claustrophobia. i regret that you had been alone with your problems all over the years! but claustrophobia is not a destiny, even if you say "it runs in my blood". have you ever heard of cbt ? this could help you for dealing with the symptoms. additionally, medication is available. would you like to a visit a doctor? kind regards, anna

input_text.799: my country is member of the cemac: central african economic and monetary community. it is an international organization which counts six countries: cameroon, centrafrique, congo, gabon, equatorial guinea and tchad. the cemac has many goals: create a very clos union between his member, delete all problems which can disturb the trade between his countries and create a real fair trade. however since my country is member of the cemac, we have not notice any change in our trade with the others countries. even the agreements that we have signed are not respected. for example we have signed an agreement which give us the right to freely go to another cemac country without the need of any visa. the agreement is just for the paper because until today, if we want to go in a cemac country we still need to have a visa. finally i think that the most important thing is not to be member of a trade agreement, but to be able to respect all agreements of this organization.

input_text.909: dear paula, as i learn from your letter your personal financial situation has changed totally so you can't go on spending so much money on food. great to hear you are not only able to spot your eating attitude as being the reason for you financial problems - you are willing to change it as well! i intentionally chose the word 'attitude' to indicate that i am not a psychological therapist, the solution for this part of the new approach to daily life you'll have to find elsewhere. however, i'd like to give you some hints for the technical part of you question. you like a caffe latte on the way to your job - what about buying some plastic cups and preparing your 'coffee to go' at home? lunch - try to buy only a soup or a little salad while the rest you want to eat has been prepared at home? and after work the most expensive habit - change it to taking just a little drink at the bar, but invite some of your friends from time to time to be together with them at home in a conveniant atmosphere; suppose to them to do the same.%% good luck, paula!
